Brooklyn Historical Society
Melanie Einzig Purim photographs
Einzig, Melanie
2011.018
750 Megabytes in 87 digital files.
0.25 Linear Feet in one folder comprising 16 prints.
circa 2011 This collection is comprised of 87 digital photographs in .jpg and .tif formats of the Jewish celebration of Purim in Williamsburg. Purim commemorates the saving of the Jewish people from Haman, an Achaemenid Persian Empire official who was planning to kill all the Jews, as recounted in the Book of Esther. These photographs document adults and children wearing masks and costumes in public settings. digital files
Conditions Governing Access
This collection is open for research without restriction.
Conditions Governing Use
The copyright status of this collection has not been assessed. Please contact library@brooklynhistory.org for more information.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Melaine Einzig in 2011.
Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
This collection is comprised of digital photographs. Access to digital materials is available onsite at the Othmer Library. Requests to access digital materials must be made at least 2 days in advance by emailing library@brooklynhistory.org.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date (if known); Melanie Einzig Purim photographs, 2011.018, Box and Folder number; Center for Brooklyn History at Brooklyn Public Library.
Processing Information
This collection was donated on 2 CDs, which were imaged using BitCurator-2.0.14. No viruses or personally identifying information were found during imaging.
